clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Phosphatidylserine has demonstrated some usefulness in treating cognitive impairment including Alzheimer s disease age associated memory impairment and some non Alzheimer s dementias More research is needed before phosphatidylserine can be indicated for immune enhancement or for reduction of exercise stress

contraindications.disease: There are no reports of overdosage LD sub 50 sub in rats is more than 5g kg and in rabbits is more than 2g kg
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Phosphatidylserine is indicated in the treatment of cognitive impairment including Alzheimer s disease age associated memory impairment and some non Alzheimer s dementias Further research is required before phosphatidylserine can be indicated for immune enhancement or for reduction of exercise stress Phosphatidylserine was first isolated from brain lipids called cephalins The major cephalins are phosphatidylserine and phophatidylethanolamine Phosphatidylserine is involved in signal transduction activity as well as being a basic structural component of biologic membranes
